titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Office of the Messrs. Rockefeller records, Winthrop Rockefeller FA403
titlestmt.author: Bethany J. Antos

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2015-08-26 16:59:08 -0400.

did.unittitle: Office of the Messrs. Rockefeller records, Winthrop Rockefeller

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Bethany J. Antos. Processing began in August of 2012 and was completed in September of 2012.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into three groups, based on subject matter:

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Winthrop Rockefeller, born May 1, 1912, was the fourth son of Abby Aldrich Rockefeller and John D. Rockefeller, Jr. After attending the Lincoln School in New York City and the Loomis School in Connecticut, Winthrop enrolled at Yale University for a short period of time. After leaving Yale, Winthrop worked as a roughneck in the oilfields in Texas.

After serving in the Army during World War II, Winthrop eventually moved to Arkansas in 1953. Purchasing a 927-acre tract of land on Petit Jean Mountain, he built Winrock Farms, which would become famous for breeding Santa Gertrudis cattle.

In 1948, Winthrop Rockefeller married Barbara "Bobo" Sears, amidst a flurry of publicity. They had one son, Winthrop Paul Rockefeller, and divorced in 1954. In 1956, Winthrop remarried Jeanette Edris, who had two children from a previous marriage. The couple divorced in 1971.
In 1955, Winthrop accepted a position as Chairman of the Arkansas Industrial Development Commission, serving for eight years.

Although his bid for governor of Arkansas was unsuccessful in 1964, Winthrop ran again in 1966 and won, making him the first Republican governor in Arkansas in 94 years. He was re-elected in 1968, and served until January 1971 as governor.
Winthrop Rockefeller died of cancer on February 22, 1973 at the age of 60.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for scholarly research with select materials restricted, as noted.

Material in the Rockefeller Family collections which provides the names, correspondence, or activities of living members of the Rockefeller Family, and/or documents the net worth of any Rockefeller Family members, is restricted from scholarly access.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Rockefeller Archive Center holds title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them, and has authority to grant permission to cite and publish archival material from the collection.

Reproduction/duplication of archival items is routinely provided in accordance with “fair use”. If the RAC does not hold copyright for an archival collection, or items within a collection, it is the users’ responsibility to contact the copyright holder, or make a fair effort to do so, prior to publication.

fileplan.head: File Plan
fileplan.p: Former classification: III 2 AD -- Rockefeller Family Archives, Record Group 2 (Office of the Messrs. Rockefeller), Series AD (Winthrop Rockefeller)

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Bethany J. Antos. Processing began in August of 2012 and was completed in September of 2012.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: For materials that complement or enhance an understanding of Winthrop Rockefeller's life and work, researchers may wish to consult the following collections at the Rockefeller Archive Center:

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Materials requiring specialized equipment for access (film, audio, video, slides) may be closed to research dependent on availability of the applicable equipment
Brittle or damaged items, or materials otherwise in need of preservation care, may be closed to researchers at the discretion of the RAC Head of Archival Services/Head of Reference.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This material was collected by Rockefeller Family and Associates (Room 5600). The materials were ultimately transferred to the Rockefeller Archive Center by Room 5600.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Family and Personal is arranged roughly alphabetically, and includes materials related to Winthrop's personal life, including correspondence and clippings maintained by the Rockefeller Family Office.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Winrock Farms is arranged alphabetically and contains items related to the Farm, mostly publicity material on the annual cattle production sales at Winrock Farms.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Speeches, Publications, and Publicity Materials is arranged alphabetically, and made up of several boxes of speeches made by Winthrop from 1937 through 1967, as well as publications by or about Winthrop Rockefeller. The majority of these materials were generated during Withrop's campaigns for Arkansas governor or during his governorships.

"Here I Stand...on Civil Rights / Education / Labor / Welfare"
